citation.article-title: Emended descriptions of Clostridium acetobutylicum and Clostridium beijerinckii, and descriptions of Clostridium saccharoperbutylacetonicum sp. nov. and Clostridium saccharobutylicum sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Clostridium beijerinckii Donker 1926

The phenotypic description of Clostridium beijerinckii is essentially the same as that given in Bergey's Manual of Systematic Bacteriology (Cato et al., 1986), based on those of Smith & Hobbs (1974) and Holdeman et al. (1977). In some instances in this study, we found the percentage of strains able to ferment certain carbohydrates to be higher than that given in Bergey's Manual, perhaps because we analysed fewer strains (16, as opposed to 60). As in Bergey's Manual, we found that the C. beijerinckii strains were unable to hydrolyse gelatin (with the exception of strain NRRL B593). Characteristics additional to the description of C. beijerinckii include the following: the ability to ferment saccharose, and the ability of the majority of the strains to utilize the alcohol sugars D- and L-arabitol, dulcitol and inositol, but glycerol only weakly. All of the strains of C. beijerinckii were also able to ferment methyl-glucopyranoside, turanose, dextrin and pectin.
